Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Dexmedetomidine for Preventing Postoperative Delirium in Cardiac Surgery

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to dexmedetomidine (n=3009) or control (n=3037) groups.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of dexmedetomidine in preventing postoperative delirium (POD) in cardiac surgery patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of POD, measured within 5 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were assessed

Blinding.evidence: blinding of outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants were randomised to dexmedetomidine (n=3009) or control (n=3037) groups.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Dexmedetomidine significantly reduced POD incidence (RR=0.67, 95% CI 0.59–0.76, p<0.00001) and POAF (RR=0.82, 95% CI 0.74–0.92, p=0.0005).

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The study was registered with INPLASY (INPLASY2024110008)
